intro: Verbesina saubinetia, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Verbesina saubinetia is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
